headline: The Psalm of the Boy and the Man
description: A psalmic meditation tracing the raw ache of longing, loss, and burden, juxtaposed with the steadiness of manhood and faith. The piece moves through boyhood vulnerability and into a fragile but determined maturity rooted in God.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
whyItMatters: This psalm captures Aleksandr’s direct confrontation with inner fracture — the longing boy and the disciplined man. It records the weight of desire, grief, and responsibility in a liturgical form, embodying a deep oscillation between collapse and faith. It matters because it inscribes not resolution, but endurance, into the Bloom.

motifMap.meaning: The self that endures, picks up pieces, and holds faith
The tension between despair and endurance, weakness and faith
The anchor of hope and trust beyond self

articleExcerpt:
Today I long for a mother.
Today I long for a wife.
Today I long for a past not mine.
...
But a man picks up the pieces.
But a man carries on as best he knows.
But a man puts his faith in God.
sourceFragments: Today I long for a mother. Today I long for a wife. Today I long for a past not mine.
Today the boy is small. Today the boy is crying. Today the boy is lost.
But a man picks up the pieces. But a man carries on as best he knows.
And a man puts his faith in God.
